overview: Mr. B.K. Gogia brings InferX proven skill in developing and executing strategic plans for advanced analytical solutions for privacy preserving in emerging markets. Mr. Gogia established InferX in 1999 to commercialize distributed data mining software developed at Datamat Systems Research, Inc., an research and development firm he founded in 1992 to develop advanced analytical solutions to serve government agencies, including Defense Research Projects Agency (DARPA), Missile Defense Agency (MDA), U.S. Army Space and Missile Defense Command (SMDC), National Geo-Spatial Agency (NGA), Department of the Navy and Air Force Research Laboratory (AFRL). Prior to this, he served as Technical Director/Software Manager at Science Applications International Corporation, and held a senior technical position with Lockheed Martin Corporation. He began his career as a systems engineer and software developer with Data General in the field of compilers and operating systems.
